info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.user.setting

get.description:
Get admin ntfn preferences gets current admin notification preferences for user.
It combines information from two sources:
- explicitly set admin notification preferences in user settings object
- default values from uam config (for those notifications which not explicitly set)

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

put.description: Update admin ntfn preferences updates admin notification preferences for the user and store them in user settings object.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

put.description:
Unset admin ntfn preference unsets specific admin notification preference for the user and store it in user settings object.
It can be used in email newsletters to allow easy unsubscribing for users.

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

email_sent.description: Boolean flag which shows whether email has been sent or not.
email_sent.title: EmailSent

last_requesting_time.description: If initial access was requested at least once, last_requesting_time contains last time when it happened.
last_requesting_time.title: Last requesting time

requested.description: Boolean flag which shows whether initial access was requested or not.
requested.title: Requested

settingNotification.description: Definition of existing notifications created for subscription.
settingNotification.title: Notification

description.description:
Description text of the notification.

Example: ` "Something to notify of"`
description.title: Notification

label.description:
Public label of the notification.

Example: ` "Notification 1"`
label.title: Label

ntfn_preferences_map.description:
Ntfn preferences map contains information whether user is enabled or disabled specific notification.

Example: ` "['notif-1':false]"`
ntfn_preferences_map.title: Ntfn preferences map

ntfn_to_unset.description:
Ntfn to unset contains notification which should be unset for particular user.

Example: ` "notif-1"`
ntfn_to_unset.title: Ntfn to unset

settingPersonaPreferences.description: Preferences to display appropriate content to appropriate audience
settingPersonaPreferences.title: Persona type

advanced_view.description: If true then more options are displayed, otherwise a simplified view is displayed
advanced_view.title: Advanced view

settingUpdateImageRequest.description: Message contains data for updating user profile image.
settingUpdateImageRequest.title: UpdateImageRequest

image.description:
Blob of the user profile image.

Example: ` "dXNlci1pbWFnZS5qcGVn"`

settingUserSession.description: UserSession contains information about active user's sessions in IAM.
settingUserSession.title: UserSession

ip_address.description:
IPAddress from which session was initialized.

Example: ` "127.0.0.1"`
ip_address.title: IPAddress

last_access.description:
Last recorded activity for the session.

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
last_access.title: LastAccess

start.description:
Time when session was initialized.

Example: ` "2020-04-20T12:32:51.341959216Z"`
start.title: Start

settingUserSessionList.description: UserSessionList contains list of user sessions.
settingUserSessionList.title: UserSessionList

user_sessions.description: UserSessions contains list of user sessions.
user_sessions.title: UserSessions

settingUserSettingsRequest.description: Allowed settings for the user to be modified.
settingUserSettingsRequest.title: UserSettingsRequest

enabled_notifications.description:
Enabled notification for specific user.

Example: ` "['notif-1','notif-2']"`
enabled_notifications.title: Enabled Notifications

first_name.description:
First name of the user.

Example: ` "Joe"`
first_name.title: First Name

image.description:
Blob of the user avatar image.

Example: ` "dXNlci1pbWFnZS5qcGVn"`
image.title: Image

last_name.description:
Last Name of the user.

Example: ` "Doe"`
last_name.title: Last Name

image.description:
Image blob field stores user's image, should be base64 encoded while used by http.

Example: ` "dXNlci1pbWFnZS5qcGVn"`
image.title: Image

is_next_request_allowed.description:
Boolean flag which shows whether re-request access is allowed or not.
 Virtually flag shows whether 24hrs are passed from the last_requesting_time timestamp or not.
is_next_request_allowed.title: Is Next Request Allowed

notifications.description: List of enabled notifications for specific user account.
notifications.title: EnabledNotification

otp_enabled.description: Switcher for configuration of enabling OTP in IAM Provider.
otp_enabled.title: OTP Enabled

settingViewPreference.description: Preferences to display appropriate content to appropriate audience
settingViewPreference.title: View preference

advanced_view.description: If true then more options are displayed, otherwise a simplified view is displayed
advanced_view.title: Advanced view

initialized.description: If true then the user picked their preference
initialized.title: Initialized

tenantOtpStatus.description:
OtpStatus can be either enabled/disabled or processing.
Applying new policy can take time, especially if tenant has many users so for this purpose processing state is introduced.

 - OTP_DISABLED: OTP_DISABLED

OTP disabled
 - OTP_ENABLED: OTP_ENABLED

OTP enabled
 - OTP_PROCESSING: OTP_PROCESSING

OTP is being updated
 - OTP_PROCESS_DISABLING: OTP_PROCESSING

OTP is being updated to be disabled
tenantOtpStatus.title: OtpStatus
